newsitem.title: USA: Mass. lawmakers wrestle with $685 mln bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Mass. lawmakers wrestle with $685 mln bond issue.

text.p: Massachusetts lawmakers are expected to reconcile this week two different versions of the $685 million general obligation issue for repairing courthouses.

Both the House and Senate passed their own versions of the measure that have the same total amount, but the $685 million in GOs is obliged differently and the difference will have to be reconciled by a conference committee.

The House has chosen not to name its members to the conference committee for the past two weeks, though there is broad agreement many courts do need repairs quickly, State House news service reported.
House Ways and Means Chairman Paul Haley told the news agency that he was not pleased to see how different the Senate version was and how much it had grown.
"We're nervous about the bottom line," Haley said. "I don't know how we resolve this at this point."
